title: How to Make a Pine Cone Center Piece

steps.headline: Select a silver platter that is at least 6-inches long.
Collect some pine cones.
steps.description: You will need a minimum of 4 pine cones but you can use more to make this project. You can use the extra pine cones to decorate your home, if desired.

steps.headline: Purchase paints in the following colors:  midnight blue, plum purple or cocoa gold spray, depending on your wall color.
Purchase some glitter at the craft store.
Purchase some string in the following colors: white, red, green, peach.
Purchase ribbon to in coordinating colors.
Sort the pine cones into rough ones and soft ones.
Dip the rough pine cones in cold water with a dash of salt.It will keep them rough and well preserved.
Dip the soft pine cones in bleach, or for the pioneer alternative, dip the pine cones in sugar, salt, water and ginger.
When using either method, remove the pine cones after letting them soak for 5 to 10 minutes.
Place the pine cones on a soft cloth to dry.
steps.description: You may find a bit of dust falling out of the pine cones but that's okay.

steps.headline: Spray all your pine cones using your choice of paint color.
steps.description: Be sure to do this in a well ventilated area such as the outdoors.

steps.headline: Place the painted pine cones on a plate.
Wrap the string around the base of the pine cones.
Tie the ribbons around the pine cones in a decorative manner.
steps.description: Use the ribbons to decorate the silver plate too, if desired.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the glitter over everything.
steps.description: Make it look natural. Put some glitter on a cloth,and wipe your table down with it if you're not using a tablecloth. Then,put some more glitter on another cloth, and dry your table with it. When finished your table will look like an old-fashioned Christmas center piece.

text: Select a silver platter that is at least 6-inches long.  Collect some pine cones. You will need a minimum of 4 pine cones but you can use more to make this project. You can use the extra pine cones to decorate your home, if desired. Purchase paints in the following colors:  midnight blue, plum purple or cocoa gold spray, depending on your wall color.  Purchase some glitter at the craft store.  Purchase some string in the following colors: white, red, green, peach.  Purchase ribbon to in coordinating colors.  Sort the pine cones into rough ones and soft ones.  Dip the rough pine cones in cold water with a dash of salt.It will keep them rough and well preserved.  Dip the soft pine cones in bleach, or for the pioneer alternative, dip the pine cones in sugar, salt, water and ginger.  When using either method, remove the pine cones after letting them soak for 5 to 10 minutes.  Place the pine cones on a soft cloth to dry. You may find a bit of dust falling out of the pine cones but that's okay. Spray all your pine cones using your choice of paint color. Be sure to do this in a well ventilated area such as the outdoors. Place the painted pine cones on a plate.  Wrap the string around the base of the pine cones. Make it look voluminous. Tie the ribbons around the pine cones in a decorative manner. Use the ribbons to decorate the silver plate too, if desired. Sprinkle the glitter over everything. Make it look natural. Put some glitter on a cloth,and wipe your table down with it if you're not using a tablecloth. Then,put some more glitter on another cloth, and dry your table with it. When finished your table will look like an old-fashioned Christmas center piece.
